markov

Class NestedMarkovNode<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • markov.Node<T>
      • markov.MarkovNode<T>
        • markov.NestedMarkovNode<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the elements that will be picked from.

    public class NestedMarkovNode<T>
extends MarkovNode<T>
    Author:
    Alexander Johnston Copyright 2020 A class where a set of elements are picked from randomly to decide which element will be the output of fun() based on the last returned elements.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NestedMarkovNode(MarkovNode<T> node)
      Creates a NestedMarkovNode by adding a new chain to node.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NestedMarkovNode

        public NestedMarkovNode(MarkovNode<T> node)
        Creates a NestedMarkovNode by adding a new chain to node. The elements in node will be added by reference.
        Parameters:
        node - as the MarkovNode to add a chain to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if node is null.

      • good

        public void good(java.util.List<T> previousElements,
                 double percent)
        Adjust the probabilities to make the previousElements more likely to return from fun() in that order.
        Parameters:
        previousElements - as the elements in the order that should appear more often.
        percent - as the percentage between 0 and 1 exclusive, of the probability to adjust all the nodes that determine the order of elements specified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if previousElements is null or any of it's elements are null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive, or if previousElements is empty

      • bad

        public void bad(java.util.List<T> previousElements,
                double percent)
        Adjust the probabilities to make the list of previousElements less likely to return from fun() in that order.
        Parameters:
        previousElements - as the elements in the order that should appear less often.
        percent - as the percentage, between 0 and 1 exclusive, of the probability to adjust all the nodes that determine the order of elements specified.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if previousElements is null or any of it's elements are null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the percent isn't between 0 and 1 exclusive, or if previousElements is empty.

      • fun

        public T fun()
        Specified by:
        fun in class Node<T>
        Returns:
        a randomly picked element from this NestedMarkovNode which is based on the previously returned elements. Any changes in the element will be reflected in this NestedMarkovNode.
